user_query: We begin: *The Way Home*. That's Sang-woo, her daughter's only son. A face marked by time, like a river etching wrinkles into the skin. We need to go before the last bus stops. Sang-woo's grandmother is mute. Listen to her and behave yourself, alright? His mom leaves for Seoul to earn money, entrusting him to his grandmother. Ow, that hurts! Ugh... It's his first time meeting his grandmother. Stupid mute To Sang-woo, she felt like a stranger. The harsh words of a thoughtless city boy don't wound her. She simply walks ahead, waiting for him to follow. Dinner time. She tears kimchi with her hands and places it gently on his rice. But Sang-woo rejects her touch. She offers him candy, carefully saved in a deep cupboard. Still, he turns his back to her. "Sang-woo's dad? We split up a long time ago." "She ran off at nineteen with no money at all." "What do you think she did to survive?" Suddenly, Sang-woo has to poop. It's his first time using a chamber pot. "What are you looking at?" "Where are you going?" Grandma sits beside him, quietly thinking about all the years he lived without a father. The next day. A boy from the nearby village stops by. "My mom said you should have this." "Is that the grandson from Seoul?" "My house is down the hill. You should come by sometime." "Find the Scavenger Solex!" In the city, Sang-woo was always alone. Making friends wasn't easy for him.
